intro: Crepis senecioides subsp. filiformis, commonly known as the slender sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. This subspecies is often found in open habitats and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
